intro: Notholcus lanatus, commonly known as the woolly meadow crakespur, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, woolly appearance. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or red, with four petals and prominent stamens. It is often found in wet meadows and marshy areas, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Notholcus lanatus is an herbaceous perennial that blooms from late spring to early summer.
